DataElement.preferredName: Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Multiple Caries Present Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no question related to presence of multiple tooth decays in treatment of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin (the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth) in tooth # 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Carious Dentin Tooth 30 Treatment Multiple Caries Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to presence of multiple tooth decays in treatment of tooth decay that has invaded the dentin (the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth) in tooth # 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, the porous, yellow-hued material between the enamel and pulp of the tooth.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Tooth decay that has invaded the dentin, creating dentin that is partially demineralized and containing mineral crystals in the tubules.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: many copies of or many forms:The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.
The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the EX1 question of the su
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the EX1 question of the survey would your response have been different if the patient had a large number of new lesions on radiographic examination, (# 30 being the most advanced)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF TEXT5
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the NE1 question of the survey would your response have been different if the patient had a large number of new lesions on radiographic examination, (# 30 being the most advanced)
